respStmt.resp: initial normalization and conversion to legacy GRETIL formats
respStmt.name: Reinhold Grünendahl

respStmt.resp: normalization and conversion to TEI-conformant markup
respStmt.name: Sebastian Nehrdich

publicationStmt.publisher: Göttingen Register of Electronic Texts in Indian Languages (GRETIL), SUB Göttingen

availability.p: This e-text was provided to GRETIL in good faith that no copyright rights have been infringed. If anyone wishes to assert copyright over this file, please contact the GRETIL management at gretil(at)sub(dot)uni-goettingen(dot)de. The file will be immediately removed pending resolution of the claim.
availability.licence: Distributed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

projectDesc.p: The Göttingen Register of Electronic Texts in Indian Languages (GRETIL) is a resource platform providing standardized machine-readable texts in Indian languages that have been contributed by various individuals and institutions.

correction.p: Apparent errors have been silently corrected.

normalization.p: GRETIL normalizes all texts contributed consistently for each language. Sanskrit texts are normalized in accordance with the scheme of the International Alphabet of Sanskrit Transliteration (IAST) in order to facilitate word search across its corpus without additional transformations.

All characters that were fully equivalent to an IAST-conformant character in the text file contributed have been made to conform to the character list below. Non-conformant characters with additional information including accents, capitalization, and whitespace have been preserved as orig elements inside choice elements with their IAST-conformant equivalent in reg elements for the creation of a plain text. These additional informations will be available only in those transformations of this file that display the original information.

table.head: Characters Used for the Transliteration of Sanskrit according to IAST

row.cell: LATIN SMALL LETTER A WITH MACRON
LATIN SMALL LETTER I WITH MACRON
LATIN SMALL LETTER U WITH MACRON
LATIN SMALL LETTER R WITH DOT BELOW
LATIN SMALL LETTER R WITH DOT BELOW AND MACRON
LATIN SMALL LETTER L WITH DOT BELOW
LATIN SMALL LETTER L WITH DOT BELOW AND MACRON
LATIN SMALL LETTER M WITH DOT BELOW
LATIN SMALL LETTER H WITH DOT BELOW
LATIN SMALL LETTER N WITH DOT ABOVE
LATIN SMALL LETTER N WITH TILDE
LATIN SMALL LETTER T WITH DOT BELOW
LATIN SMALL LETTER D WITH DOT BELOW
LATIN SMALL LETTER N WITH DOT BELOW
LATIN SMALL LETTER S WITH ACUTE
LATIN SMALL LETTER S WITH DOT BELOW

quotation.p: If indicated unambiguously in the text file contributed quotation marks have been replaced with the q element and, in case a reference was provided, have been nested inside a cit with the respective reference provided in a ref element after the quote.

segmentation.p: Unnumbered div elements are used to structure the text, using the type and n attributes in accordance with the refsDecl.

interpretation.p:
Interpretive markup which is visible only in analytic transformations of this file consists of:
Highlighting in hi elements,
Corruptions in sic elements,
Remarks in note elements with the @resp attribute identifying the agency.

refsDecl.p:
A reference is given in the xml:id attributes consisting of
a pragmatic abbreviation of the title: ,
the number of the in arabic numerals,
the number of the in arabic numerals,
the number of the verse in arabic numerals,
if applicable: the string ":c" to signify a commentary to the preceding p or lg element,
if applicable: the number of a verse in a commentary in arabic numerals.
